intro: Hieracium leiocephalum, commonly known as the smooth-headed hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is native to Europe and parts of western Asia. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium leiocephalum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
